docs.title: Polymer for Pantheon Drupal Applications
docs.text: This package provides a suite of commands designed to integrate Polymer WebOps Tooling with Pantheon-hosted Drupal applications, enhancing your Drupal development experience with Pantheon. The commands provided by this package aim to help users manage their Pantheon applications more effectively by incorporating what the community has learned over the years from working with Pantheon-hosted Drupal applications.

docs.title: Quick start
docs.text: Clone the repository and run ddev init. This will re-create the development environment, build the documentation, and launch the local version of the documentation site in your browser.

docs.title: DDEV
docs.text: This application is developed with DDEV.

docs.title: ddev init
docs.text: Initializes the development environment for this tool.

docs.title: ddev build-docs
docs.text:
Builds the documentation site for this tool.

When updating command documentation, run polymer mk:docs to re-generate these files.

Tip

Run ddev launch :444 to open the site in your browser after running ddev build-docs.

docs.title: ddev dev-docs
docs.text:
Starts the mkdocs build server and watches for changes.

Run ddev launch :445 to open the dev site in your browser.

When updating command documentation, run polymer mk:docs to re-generate these files.

Tip

When making changes to the documentation, this is the recommended method to use as it hot reloads changes in the browser.

docs.title: Pantheon Files and Quicksilver
docs.text:
Run polymer pantheon:files:setup:drupal to fully set up needed Pantheon files.

The following files will be (relative to repository root) created or modified:

  • polymer.yml
  • web/private/scripts/cache_rebuild.sh
  • web/private/scripts/database_updates.sh
  • web/private/scripts/drush_config_import.sh
  • web/private/scripts/drush_deploy_hook.sh

docs.title: Quicksilver
docs.text:
The pantheon:quicksilver-scripts:inject-hooks (possibly run as part of pantheon:files:setup:drupal) command will inject Drupal deployment workflow scripts into the project's pantheon.yml file. The steps are the equivalent of running drush deploy.

The commands are broken out individually because Quicksilver script execution times out after 2 minutes. Instead of having a single command that can time out after 2 minutes, we instead run each deployment command individually, each getting the maximum 2 minutes to run before timing out. This maximizes the chances of a successful deployment.

Note

The drush deploy command is effectively broken down into:

  • drush cr
  • drush updb
  • drush cim
  • drush deploy:hook

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
To install the workflows, run the following command:

polymer pantheon:workflow:generate github

Provided by this extension are two workflows:

  • pantheon-push.yml
  • pantheon-push-dev.yml

docs.title: pantheon-push.yml
docs.text:
This workflow is meant to be invoked by other workflows.

It requires two inputs:

  • artifact: The configured artifact ID to compile.
  • branch: The branch pushed to Pantheon, with the compiled artifact.

It requires two secrets:

  • SSH_KEY: The GitHub Actions secret which contains an SSH private key that can be used to push to Pantheon.
  • KNOWN_HOSTS: The GitHub Actions secret which contains the known hosts file for the Pantheon repository.

Note

The workflow may need alterations to satisfy all build requirements for the artifact, such as installing npm or yarn at specific versions.

docs.title: pantheon-push-dev.yml
docs.text:
This workflow is meant to be invoked by the pantheon-push.yml workflow.

By default, this workflow will run on pushes to the main branch of the source repository and will push the compiled artifact to the master branch on Pantheon, which will deploy the artifact to the dev environment.

docs.title: artifact:build:prepare
docs.text: Prepare the artifact build dir.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: • polymer artifact:build:prepare. Removes sensitive files from the deploy dir.

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:
• -h, --help. Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
  • --silent. Do not output any message
  • -q, --quiet. Only errors are displayed. All other output is suppressed
  • -v|vv|vvv, --verbose. Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
  • -V, --version. Display this application version
  • --ansi. Force (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
  • -n, --no-interaction. Do not ask any interactive question
  • --simulate. Run in simulated mode (show what would have happened).
  • --progress-delay=PROGRESS-DELAY. Number of seconds before progress bar is displayed in long-running task collections. Default: 2s.
  • -D, --define=DEFINE. Define a configuration item value.
  • --environment=ENVIRONMENT. Set the environment to load config from polymer/[env].polymer.yml file.
  • --site=SITE. The multisite to execute this command against.

Legend

  • An argument or option with square brackets is optional.
  • Any default value is listed at end of arg/option description.
  • An ellipsis indicates that an argument accepts multiple values separated by a space.

docs.title: artifact:deploy
docs.text: Builds separate artifact and pushes to 'git.remotes' defined polymer.yml.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: • polymer artifact:deploy -v. Builds separate artifact and pushes to git.remotes.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • artifact. The name of the artifact to deploy.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --branch=BRANCH. The branch name.
  • --tag=TAG. The tag name.
  • --commit-msg=COMMIT-MSG. The commit message.
  • --dry-run. Show the deploy operations without pushing the artifact.

docs.title: build
docs.text: Builds the specified build target.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• polymer build theme_build_admin. Runs and builds the "theme_build_admin" target.
  • polymer build -v. Runs and builds all frontend targets.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • [target]. The name of the build target to build.

docs.title: completion
docs.text:
Dump the shell completion script

The *%command.name% command dumps the shell completion script required to use shell autocompletion (currently, bash, fish, zsh completion are supported).

docs.title:
Static installation

Dump the script to a global completion file and restart your shell:

*%command.full_name%  | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/polymer

Or dump the script to a local file and source it:

*%command.full_name%  > completion.sh

<comment># source the file whenever you use the project
*source completion.sh

<comment># or add this line at the end of your "~/.bashrc" file:
*source /path/to/completion.sh

Dynamic installation

Add this to the end of your shell configuration file (e.g. *"~/.bashrc"):

*eval "$(/home/runner/work/polymer-pantheon-drupal/polymer-pantheon-drupal/vendor/bin/polymer completion )"
Arguments
docs.text: • [shell]. The shell type (e.g. "bash"), the value of the "$SHELL" env var will be used if this is not given

docs.title: Options
docs.text: • --debug. Tail the completion debug log

docs.title: Global Options

docs.title: composer:validate:security
docs.text: Check security vulnerability in composer packages.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• polymer composer:validate:security. Check security vulnerability in composer packages.
  • polymer composer:validate:security --no-dev. Do not inspect dev dependencies.
  • polymer composer:validate:security --locked. Only look at what is in the lock file.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --no-dev. Disables auditing of require-dev packages.
  • --locked. Audit based on the lock file instead of the installed packages.

docs.title: drupal:setup:ddev
docs.text:
Set up DDEV databases and generate DDEV configuration files.

Creates databases based on site directory names and generates a DDEV config file that includes hooks for ensuring the databases are created when the project starts going forward.

docs.title: drupal:setup:site:files
docs.text:
Set up a site's files.

Ensures that the following files are present:

  • Global settings (common to all sites)
  • Site-specific settings and Drush files

Also ensures that the polymer.settings.php file is included in the site's settings.php file.

docs.title: drupal:site:sync
docs.text:

Copies remote db to local db, re-imports config, and executes db updates fro default site.

docs.title: drupal:upgrade
docs.text:
Upgrade Drupal codebase and export changes.

Part of this operation ensures that all multisites are updated and their configuration is exported, if the site uses a configuration management strategy that exports config.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: • drupal:upgrade --new-version=10.2.3. Upgrades Drupal core to version 10.2.3.

docs.title: Options
docs.text: • --new-version. The specific Drupal core version to upgrade to.

docs.title: drupal:upgrade:export
docs.text:
Run database updates and export configuration for a site.

Note that configuration will only be exported if the site's configuration management strategy is one of the following:

  • config-split
  • core-only

docs.title: help
docs.text:
Display help for a command

The %command.name% command displays help for a given command:

%command.full_name% list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

%command.full_name% --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • [command_name]. The command name

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --format=FORMAT. The output format (txt, xml, json, or md) [default: txt]
  • --raw. To output raw command help

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:

  • --environment=ENVIRONMENT. Set the environment to load config from polymer/[env].polymer.yml file.
  • --site=SITE. The multisite to execute this command against.

docs.title: list
docs.text:
List commands

The %command.name% command lists all commands:

%command.full_name%

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

%command.full_name% test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

%command.full_name% --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

%command.full_name% --raw

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • [namespace]. The namespace name

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --raw. To output raw command list
  • --format=FORMAT. The output format (txt, xml, json, or md) [default: txt]
  • --short. To skip describing commands' arguments

  • -v|vv|vvv, --verbose. Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
  • -V, --version. Display this application version
  • --ansi. Force (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
  • -n, --no-interaction. Do not ask any interactive question
  • --simulate. Run in simulated mode (show what would have happened).
  • --progress-delay=PROGRESS-DELAY. Number of seconds before progress bar is displayed in long-running task collections. Default: 2s.
  • -D, --define=DEFINE. Define a configuration item value.
  • --environment=ENVIRONMENT. Set the environment to load config from polymer/[env].polymer.yml file.
  • --site=SITE. The multisite to execute this command against.

Legend

  • An argument or option with square brackets is optional.
  • Any default value is listed at end of arg/option description.
  • An ellipsis indicates that an argument accepts multiple values separated by a space.

docs.title: source:build:copy
docs.text: Copies files from source repo into artifact.

docs.title: Options

docs.title: template:generate:file
docs.text: Generate a template file.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • template. Template ID to generate.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --force[=FORCE]. Overwrite destination file if it already exists. [default: 1]
  • --no-force. Negate --force option.

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:

docs.title: template:list:collections
docs.text: List collections and their counts.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --format=FORMAT. Format the result data. Available formats: csv,json,list,null,php,print-r,sections,string,table,tsv,var_dump,var_export,xml,yaml [default: table]
  • --fields=FIELDS. Available fields: Collection (collection), Count (count)
  • --field=FIELD. Select just one field, and force format to string.

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:
• -h, --help. Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
  • --silent. Do not output any message

docs.title: template:list:templates
docs.text: List templates and their related information.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --collection[=COLLECTION]. List templates in this collection. [default: all]
  • --format=FORMAT. Format the result data. Available formats: csv,json,list,null,php,print-r,sections,string,table,tsv,var_dump,var_export,xml,yaml [default: table]
  • --fields=FIELDS. Available fields: ID (id), Description (description), Tokens (tokens), Collections (collections) [default: id description tokens collections]
  • --field=FIELD. Select just one field, and force format to string.
